alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Holt (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 5:10PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Rock, northwestern Holt, east central Keya Paha and southern Boyd Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 510 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Stuart to near Butte. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spencer, Atkinson, Stuart, Butte, Lynch, Bristow, Dustin, Hull Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Mariaville, Spencer Dam, Midway, Parshall Bridge State Wildlife Management Area and Anncar. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 284 and 293. Highway 281 between mile markers 197 and 215. Highway 12 between mile markers 101 and 139. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
